.@POTUS released another irresponsible budget that is dead-on-arrival. The #TrumpBudget extends the #GOPTaxScam, breaks his campaign promise to balance the budget, puts us at risk of another #TrumpShutdown, repeals the #ACA, slashes Medicare, & more: http://bit.ly/2u4VhTi

Also told press House Dems introduced #HR6, the #DREAM & Promise Act, today. I hope @HouseGOP will join us in supporting this bill to provide #DREAMers & those w #TPS & #DED a path to citizenship. Once it passes the House, I hope the Senate will take it up & @POTUS will sign it.

In addition, I told reporters today that the #TrumpBudget is one of the most fiscally reckless budgets I’ve seen in my lifetime. This is an unserious proposal that threatens another #TrumpShutdown, repeals the #ACA, uses budget gimmicks, & slashes Medicare & Medicaid.

I opened my presser today by discussing #SunshineWeek. After passing #HR1, which restores our democracy, House Dems are taking up bills to increase govt transparency, including a resolution expressing a sense of Congress that the Mueller report should be made public.

.@POTUS’ budget is a nonstarter & must be rejected. This proposal is yet another attack on federal workers' pay & benefits; repeals the #ACA; & fails to invest in infrastructure, education, & programs to improve the health of the #ChesapeakeBay. https://bit.ly/2F60sZp
10. Why doesn’t the budget include investments to assist small businesses that have been endangered by President Trump’s economic policies?  #TrumpBudget

9. In light of dangerous weather events across the country, including deadly tornadoes in Alabama, why does the budget cut funding levels for #climatechange and protections for clean air and water from the @EPA? #TrumpBudget

8. Do Republicans have any real plan or detail as to how they plan to spend the $200 billion the Admin has requested for #infrastructure? Will they follow their previous proposal that was rejected out of hand by Dems & Republicans for lack of detail or seriousness? #TrumpBudget

7. How can Republicans seriously propose using the overseas contingency operations account (OCO) to boost defense funding at the risk of non-defense funding when even Mick Mulvaney has called OCO a “slush fund and gimmick?” #TrumpBudget

6. Why would Republicans extend tax cuts for the wealthy in the #GOPtaxscam when the facts show that the law only enriched investors and hasn’t resulted in the job creation or economic growth that the Administration promised? #TrumpBudget
5. Given the trillion dollar deficits projected for four straight years in this budget, will Republicans admit that tax cuts do NOT pay for themselves? #TrumpBudget

4. Are Republicans prepared to admit they are NOT the party of fiscal responsibility, because the budget doesn’t balance for at least 15 years – breaking President Trump’s campaign promise to balance the budget within eight years? #TrumpBudget

3. After the American people resoundingly rejected Republican efforts to undermine the Affordable Care Act in the last election, why would the Administration propose repealing the #ACA once again? #TrumpBudget
2. How will Republicans explain to seniors that they want to cut $845 billion from #Medicare? #TrumpBudget

1. How can Republicans justify an $8.6 billion request to fund a border wall that Congress just rejected and that President Trump’s former chief of staff John Kelly recently said would be “a waste of money?” #TrumpBudget
